Instruction: Preheat your oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease and flour a 9-inch round baking dish.
Combine self-rising flour, sugar, and butter in a large bowl using a pastry cutter until the mixture has a coarse crumb texture. Add raisins and mix well.

Whisk together an egg with 1 cup of milk in a separate bowl. Gently incorporate the milk mixture into the flour mixture until a dough forms. Transfer the dough to the prepared baking dish, and brush the top with 1 tablespoon of milk for a golden brown crust.
Bake the bread in the preheated oven. Lower the temperature to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and bake for 1 hour. Allow to cool before serving.
